81  /** An abstract IPC service.  IPC calls take a single {@link Writable} as a
82   * parameter, and return a {@link Writable} as their value.  A service runs on
83   * a port and is defined by a parameter class and a value class.
84   *
85   *
86   * <p>Copied local so can fix HBASE-900.
87   *
88   * @see HBaseClient
89   */
90  public abstract class HBaseServer implements RpcServer {

129   private static final Map<String, Class<? extends VersionedProtocol>>
130       PROTOCOL_CACHE =
131       new ConcurrentHashMap<String, Class<? extends VersionedProtocol>>();
132 
133   static Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> getProtocolClass(
134       String protocolName, Configuration conf)
135   throws ClassNotFoundException {
136     Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol =
137         PROTOCOL_CACHE.get(protocolName);
138 
139     if (protocol == null) {
140       protocol = (Class<? extends VersionedProtocol>)
141           conf.getClassByName(protocolName);
142       PROTOCOL_CACHE.put(protocolName, protocol);
143     }
144     return protocol;
145   }

243   /**
244    * A convenience method to bind to a given address and report
245    * better exceptions if the address is not a valid host.
246    * @param socket the socket to bind
247    * @param address the address to bind to
248    * @param backlog the number of connections allowed in the queue
249    * @throws BindException if the address can't be bound
250    * @throws UnknownHostException if the address isn't a valid host name
251    * @throws IOException other random errors from bind
252    */
253   public static void bind(ServerSocket socket, InetSocketAddress address,
254                           int backlog) throws IOException {
255     try {
256       socket.bind(address, backlog);
257     } catch (BindException e) {
258       BindException bindException =
259         new BindException("Problem binding to " + address + " : " +
260             e.getMessage());
261       bindException.initCause(e);
262       throw bindException;
263     } catch (SocketException e) {
264       // If they try to bind to a different host's address, give a better
265       // error message.
266       if ("Unresolved address".equals(e.getMessage())) {
267         throw new UnknownHostException("Invalid hostname for server: " +
268                                        address.getHostName());
269       }
270       throw e;
271     }
272   }

274   /** A call queued for handling. */
275   protected class Call implements RpcCallContext {
276     protected int id;                             // the client's call id
277     protected Writable param;                     // the parameter passed
278     protected Connection connection;              // connection to client
279     protected long timestamp;      // the time received when response is null
280                                    // the time served when response is not null
281     protected ByteBuffer response;                // the response for this call
282     protected boolean delayResponse;
283     protected Responder responder;
284     protected boolean delayReturnValue;           // if the return value should be
285                                                   // set at call completion
286     protected long size;                          // size of current call
287     protected boolean isError;
288 
289     public Call(int id, Writable param, Connection connection,
290         Responder responder, long size) {
291       this.id = id;
292       this.param = param;
293       this.connection = connection;
294       this.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
295       this.response = null;
296       this.delayResponse = false;
297       this.responder = responder;
298       this.isError = false;
299       this.size = size;
300     }
301 
302     @Override
303     public String toString() {
304       return param.toString() + " from " + connection.toString();
305     }
306 
307     protected synchronized void setResponse(Object value, Status status,
308         String errorClass, String error) {
309       // Avoid overwriting an error value in the response.  This can happen if
310       // endDelayThrowing is called by another thread before the actual call
311       // returning.
312       if (this.isError)
313         return;
314       if (errorClass != null) {
315         this.isError = true;
316       }
317       Writable result = null;
318       if (value instanceof Writable) {
319         result = (Writable) value;
320       } else {
321         /* We might have a null value and errors. Avoid creating a
322          * HbaseObjectWritable, because the constructor fails on null. */
323         if (value != null) {
324           result = new HbaseObjectWritable(value);
325         }
326       }
327 
328       int size = BUFFER_INITIAL_SIZE;
329       if (result instanceof WritableWithSize) {
330         // get the size hint.
331         WritableWithSize ohint = (WritableWithSize) result;
332         long hint = ohint.getWritableSize() + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE +
333           (2 * Bytes.SIZEOF_INT);
334         if (hint > Integer.MAX_VALUE) {
335           // oops, new problem.
336           IOException ioe =
337             new IOException("Result buffer size too large: " + hint);
338           errorClass = ioe.getClass().getName();
339           error = StringUtils.stringifyException(ioe);
340         } else {
341           size = (int)hint;
342         }
343       }
344 
345       ByteBufferOutputStream buf = new ByteBufferOutputStream(size);
346       DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(buf);
347       try {
348         // Call id.
349         out.writeInt(this.id);
350         // Write flag.
351         byte flag = (error != null)?
352           ResponseFlag.getErrorAndLengthSet(): ResponseFlag.getLengthSetOnly();
353         out.writeByte(flag);
354         // Place holder for length set later below after we
355         // fill the buffer with data.
356         out.writeInt(0xdeadbeef);
357         out.writeInt(status.state);
358       } catch (IOException e) {
359         errorClass = e.getClass().getName();
360         error = StringUtils.stringifyException(e);
361       }
362 
363       try {
364         if (error == null) {
365           result.write(out);
366         } else {
367           WritableUtils.writeString(out, errorClass);
368           WritableUtils.writeString(out, error);
369         }
370       } catch (IOException e) {
371         LOG.warn("Error sending response to call: ", e);
372       }
373 
374       // Set the length into the ByteBuffer after call id and after
375       // byte flag.
376       ByteBuffer bb = buf.getByteBuffer();
377       int bufSiz = bb.remaining();
378       // Move to the size location in our ByteBuffer past call.id
379       // and past the byte flag.
380       bb.position(Bytes.SIZEOF_INT + Bytes.SIZEOF_BYTE); 
381       bb.putInt(bufSiz);
382       bb.position(0);
383       this.response = bb;
384     }
385 
386     @Override
387     public synchronized void endDelay(Object result) throws IOException {
388       assert this.delayResponse;
389       assert this.delayReturnValue || result == null;
390       this.delayResponse = false;
391       delayedCalls.decrementAndGet();
392       if (this.delayReturnValue)
393         this.setResponse(result, Status.SUCCESS, null, null);
394       this.responder.doRespond(this);
395     }
396 
397     @Override
398     public synchronized void endDelay() throws IOException {
399       this.endDelay(null);
400     }
401 
402     @Override
403     public synchronized void startDelay(boolean delayReturnValue) {
404       assert !this.delayResponse;
405       this.delayResponse = true;
406       this.delayReturnValue = delayReturnValue;
407       int numDelayed = delayedCalls.incrementAndGet();
408       if (numDelayed > warnDelayedCalls) {
409         LOG.warn("Too many delayed calls: limit " + warnDelayedCalls +
410             " current " + numDelayed);
411       }
412     }
413 
414     @Override
415     public synchronized void endDelayThrowing(Throwable t) throws IOException {
416       this.setResponse(null, Status.ERROR, t.getClass().toString(),
417           StringUtils.stringifyException(t));
418       this.delayResponse = false;
419       this.sendResponseIfReady();
420     }
421 
422     @Override
423     public synchronized boolean isDelayed() {
424       return this.delayResponse;
425     }
426 
427     @Override
428     public synchronized boolean isReturnValueDelayed() {
429       return this.delayReturnValue;
430     }
431     
432     @Override
433     public void throwExceptionIfCallerDisconnected(String regionName)
434         throws CallerDisconnectedException {
435       if (!connection.channel.isOpen()) {
436         long afterTime = System.currentTimeMillis() - timestamp;
437         throw new CallerDisconnectedException(
438             "Aborting on region " + regionName + ", call " +
439              this + " after " + afterTime + " ms, since " +
440             "caller disconnected");
441       }
442     }
443 
444     public long getSize() {
445       return this.size;
446     }
447 
448     /**
449      * If we have a response, and delay is not set, then respond
450      * immediately.  Otherwise, do not respond to client.  This is
451      * called the by the RPC code in the context of the Handler thread.
452      */
453     public synchronized void sendResponseIfReady() throws IOException {
454       if (!this.delayResponse) {
455         this.responder.doRespond(this);
456       }
457     }
458   }

460   /** Listens on the socket. Creates jobs for the handler threads*/
461   private class Listener extends Thread {
462 
463     private ServerSocketChannel acceptChannel = null; //the accept channel
464     private Selector selector = null; //the selector that we use for the server
465     private Reader[] readers = null;
466     private int currentReader = 0;
467     private InetSocketAddress address; //the address we bind at
468     private Random rand = new Random();
469     private long lastCleanupRunTime = 0; //the last time when a cleanup connec-
470                                          //-tion (for idle connections) ran
471     private long cleanupInterval = 10000; //the minimum interval between
472                                           //two cleanup runs
473     private int backlogLength = conf.getInt("ipc.server.listen.queue.size", 128);
474 
475     private ExecutorService readPool;
476 
477     public Listener() throws IOException {
478       address = new InetSocketAddress(bindAddress, port);
479       // Create a new server socket and set to non blocking mode
480       acceptChannel = ServerSocketChannel.open();
481       acceptChannel.configureBlocking(false);
482 
483       // Bind the server socket to the local host and port
484       bind(acceptChannel.socket(), address, backlogLength);
485       port = acceptChannel.socket().getLocalPort(); //Could be an ephemeral port
486       // create a selector;
487       selector= Selector.open();
488 
489       readers = new Reader[readThreads];
490       readPool = Executors.newFixedThreadPool(readThreads,
491         new ThreadFactoryBuilder().setNameFormat(
492           "IPC Reader %d on port " + port).setDaemon(true).build());
493       for (int i = 0; i < readThreads; ++i) {
494         Reader reader = new Reader();
495         readers[i] = reader;
496         readPool.execute(reader);
497       }
498 
499       // Register accepts on the server socket with the selector.
500       acceptChannel.register(selector, SelectionKey.OP_ACCEPT);
501       this.setName("IPC Server listener on " + port);
502       this.setDaemon(true);
503     }
504 
505 
506     private class Reader implements Runnable {
507       private volatile boolean adding = false;
508       private final Selector readSelector;
509 
510       Reader() throws IOException {
511         this.readSelector = Selector.open();
512       }
513       public void run() {
514         LOG.info("Starting " + getName());
515         try {
516           doRunLoop();
517         } finally {
518           try {
519             readSelector.close();
520           } catch (IOException ioe) {
521             LOG.error("Error closing read selector in " + getName(), ioe);
522           }
523         }
524       }
525 
526       private synchronized void doRunLoop() {
527         while (running) {
528           SelectionKey key = null;
529           try {
530             readSelector.select();
531             while (adding) {
532               this.wait(1000);
533             }
534 
535             Iterator<SelectionKey> iter = readSelector.selectedKeys().iterator();
536             while (iter.hasNext()) {
537               key = iter.next();
538               iter.remove();
539               if (key.isValid()) {
540                 if (key.isReadable()) {
541                   doRead(key);
542                 }
543               }
544               key = null;
545             }
546           } catch (InterruptedException e) {
547             if (running) {                      // unexpected -- log it
548               LOG.info(getName() + " unexpectedly interrupted: " +
549                   StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
550             }
551           } catch (IOException ex) {
552             LOG.error("Error in Reader", ex);
553           }
554         }
555       }
556 
557       /**
558        * This gets reader into the state that waits for the new channel
559        * to be registered with readSelector. If it was waiting in select()
560        * the thread will be woken up, otherwise whenever select() is called
561        * it will return even if there is nothing to read and wait
562        * in while(adding) for finishAdd call
563        */
564       public void startAdd() {
565         adding = true;
566         readSelector.wakeup();
567       }
568 
569       public synchronized SelectionKey registerChannel(SocketChannel channel)
570         throws IOException {
571         return channel.register(readSelector, SelectionKey.OP_READ);
572       }
573 
574       public synchronized void finishAdd() {
575         adding = false;
576         this.notify();
577       }
578     }
579 
580     /** cleanup connections from connectionList. Choose a random range
581      * to scan and also have a limit on the number of the connections
582      * that will be cleanedup per run. The criteria for cleanup is the time
583      * for which the connection was idle. If 'force' is true then all
584      * connections will be looked at for the cleanup.
585      * @param force all connections will be looked at for cleanup
586      */
587     private void cleanupConnections(boolean force) {
588       if (force || numConnections > thresholdIdleConnections) {
589         long currentTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
590         if (!force && (currentTime - lastCleanupRunTime) < cleanupInterval) {
591           return;
592         }
593         int start = 0;
594         int end = numConnections - 1;
595         if (!force) {
596           start = rand.nextInt() % numConnections;
597           end = rand.nextInt() % numConnections;
598           int temp;
599           if (end < start) {
600             temp = start;
601             start = end;
602             end = temp;
603           }
604         }
605         int i = start;
606         int numNuked = 0;
607         while (i <= end) {
608           Connection c;
609           synchronized (connectionList) {
610             try {
611               c = connectionList.get(i);
612             } catch (Exception e) {return;}
613           }
614           if (c.timedOut(currentTime)) {
615             if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
616               LOG.debug(getName() + ": disconnecting client " + c.getHostAddress());
617             closeConnection(c);
618             numNuked++;
619             end--;
620             //noinspection UnusedAssignment
621             c = null;
622             if (!force && numNuked == maxConnectionsToNuke) break;
623           }
624           else i++;
625         }
626         lastCleanupRunTime = System.currentTimeMillis();
627       }
628     }
629 
630     @Override
631     public void run() {
632       LOG.info(getName() + ": starting");
633       SERVER.set(HBaseServer.this);
634 
635       while (running) {
636         SelectionKey key = null;
637         try {
638           selector.select(); // FindBugs IS2_INCONSISTENT_SYNC
639           Iterator<SelectionKey> iter = selector.selectedKeys().iterator();
640           while (iter.hasNext()) {
641             key = iter.next();
642             iter.remove();
643             try {
644               if (key.isValid()) {
645                 if (key.isAcceptable())
646                   doAccept(key);
647               }
648             } catch (IOException ignored) {
649             }
650             key = null;
651           }
652         } catch (OutOfMemoryError e) {
653           if (errorHandler != null) {
654             if (errorHandler.checkOOME(e)) {
655               LOG.info(getName() + ": exiting on OOME");
656               closeCurrentConnection(key, e);
657               cleanupConnections(true);
658               return;
659             }
660           } else {
661             // we can run out of memory if we have too many threads
662             // log the event and sleep for a minute and give
663             // some thread(s) a chance to finish
664             LOG.warn("Out of Memory in server select", e);
665             closeCurrentConnection(key, e);
666             cleanupConnections(true);
667             try { Thread.sleep(60000); } catch (Exception ignored) {}
668       }
669         } catch (Exception e) {
670           closeCurrentConnection(key, e);
671         }
672         cleanupConnections(false);
673       }
674       LOG.info("Stopping " + this.getName());
675 
676       synchronized (this) {
677         try {
678           acceptChannel.close();
679           selector.close();
680         } catch (IOException ignored) { }
681 
682         selector= null;
683         acceptChannel= null;
684 
685         // clean up all connections
686         while (!connectionList.isEmpty()) {
687           closeConnection(connectionList.remove(0));
688         }
689       }
690     }
691 
692     private void closeCurrentConnection(SelectionKey key, Throwable e) {
693       if (key != null) {
694         Connection c = (Connection)key.attachment();
695         if (c != null) {
696           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
697             LOG.debug(getName() + ": disconnecting client " + c.getHostAddress() +
698                 (e != null ? " on error " + e.getMessage() : ""));
699           }
700           closeConnection(c);
701           key.attach(null);
702         }
703       }
704     }
705 
706     InetSocketAddress getAddress() {
707       return (InetSocketAddress)acceptChannel.socket().getLocalSocketAddress();
708     }
709 
710     void doAccept(SelectionKey key) throws IOException, OutOfMemoryError {
711       Connection c;
712       ServerSocketChannel server = (ServerSocketChannel) key.channel();
713 
714       SocketChannel channel;
715       while ((channel = server.accept()) != null) {
716         channel.configureBlocking(false);
717         channel.socket().setTcpNoDelay(tcpNoDelay);
718         channel.socket().setKeepAlive(tcpKeepAlive);
719 
720         Reader reader = getReader();
721         try {
722           reader.startAdd();
723           SelectionKey readKey = reader.registerChannel(channel);
724           c = getConnection(channel, System.currentTimeMillis());
725           readKey.attach(c);
726           synchronized (connectionList) {
727             connectionList.add(numConnections, c);
728             numConnections++;
729           }
730           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
731             LOG.debug("Server connection from " + c.toString() +
732                 "; # active connections: " + numConnections +
733                 "; # queued calls: " + callQueue.size());
734         } finally {
735           reader.finishAdd();
736         }
737       }
738       rpcMetrics.numOpenConnections.set(numConnections);
739     }
740 
741     void doRead(SelectionKey key) throws InterruptedException {
742       int count = 0;
743       Connection c = (Connection)key.attachment();
744       if (c == null) {
745         return;
746       }
747       c.setLastContact(System.currentTimeMillis());
748 
749       try {
750         count = c.readAndProcess();
751       } catch (InterruptedException ieo) {
752         throw ieo;
753       } catch (Exception e) {
754         LOG.warn(getName() + ": readAndProcess threw exception " + e + ". Count of bytes read: " + count, e);
755         count = -1; //so that the (count < 0) block is executed
756       }
757       if (count < 0) {
758         if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
759           LOG.debug(getName() + ": disconnecting client " +
760                     c.getHostAddress() + ". Number of active connections: "+
761                     numConnections);
762         closeConnection(c);
763         // c = null;
764       }
765       else {
766         c.setLastContact(System.currentTimeMillis());
767       }
768     }
769 
770     synchronized void doStop() {
771       if (selector != null) {
772         selector.wakeup();
773         Thread.yield();
774       }
775       if (acceptChannel != null) {
776         try {
777           acceptChannel.socket().close();
778         } catch (IOException e) {
779           LOG.info(getName() + ":Exception in closing listener socket. " + e);
780         }
781       }
782       readPool.shutdownNow();
783     }
784 
785     // The method that will return the next reader to work with
786     // Simplistic implementation of round robin for now
787     Reader getReader() {
788       currentReader = (currentReader + 1) % readers.length;
789       return readers[currentReader];
790     }
791   }
792 
793   // Sends responses of RPC back to clients.
794   protected class Responder extends Thread {
795     private final Selector writeSelector;
796     private int pending;         // connections waiting to register
797 
798     Responder() throws IOException {
799       this.setName("IPC Server Responder");
800       this.setDaemon(true);
801       writeSelector = Selector.open(); // create a selector
802       pending = 0;
803     }
804 
805     @Override
806     public void run() {
807       LOG.info(getName() + ": starting");
808       SERVER.set(HBaseServer.this);
809       try {
810         doRunLoop();
811       } finally {
812         LOG.info("Stopping " + this.getName());
813         try {
814           writeSelector.close();
815         } catch (IOException ioe) {
816           LOG.error("Couldn't close write selector in " + this.getName(), ioe);
817         }
818       }
819     }
820 
821     private void doRunLoop() {
822       long lastPurgeTime = 0;   // last check for old calls.
823 
824       while (running) {
825         try {
826           waitPending();     // If a channel is being registered, wait.
827           writeSelector.select(purgeTimeout);
828           Iterator<SelectionKey> iter = writeSelector.selectedKeys().iterator();
829           while (iter.hasNext()) {
830             SelectionKey key = iter.next();
831             iter.remove();
832             try {
833               if (key.isValid() && key.isWritable()) {
834                   doAsyncWrite(key);
835               }
836             } catch (IOException e) {
837               LOG.info(getName() + ": doAsyncWrite threw exception " + e);
838             }
839           }
840           long now = System.currentTimeMillis();
841           if (now < lastPurgeTime + purgeTimeout) {
842             continue;
843           }
844           lastPurgeTime = now;
845           //
846           // If there were some calls that have not been sent out for a
847           // long time, discard them.
848           //
849           LOG.debug("Checking for old call responses.");
850           ArrayList<Call> calls;
851 
852           // get the list of channels from list of keys.
853           synchronized (writeSelector.keys()) {
854             calls = new ArrayList<Call>(writeSelector.keys().size());
855             iter = writeSelector.keys().iterator();
856             while (iter.hasNext()) {
857               SelectionKey key = iter.next();
858               Call call = (Call)key.attachment();
859               if (call != null && key.channel() == call.connection.channel) {
860                 calls.add(call);
861               }
862             }
863           }
864 
865           for(Call call : calls) {
866             try {
867               doPurge(call, now);
868             } catch (IOException e) {
869               LOG.warn("Error in purging old calls " + e);
870             }
871           }
872         } catch (OutOfMemoryError e) {
873           if (errorHandler != null) {
874             if (errorHandler.checkOOME(e)) {
875               LOG.info(getName() + ": exiting on OOME");
876               return;
877             }
878           } else {
879             //
880             // we can run out of memory if we have too many threads
881             // log the event and sleep for a minute and give
882             // some thread(s) a chance to finish
883             //
884             LOG.warn("Out of Memory in server select", e);
885             try { Thread.sleep(60000); } catch (Exception ignored) {}
886           }
887         } catch (Exception e) {
888           LOG.warn("Exception in Responder " +
889                    StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
890         }
891       }
892       LOG.info("Stopping " + this.getName());
893     }
894 
895     private void doAsyncWrite(SelectionKey key) throws IOException {
896       Call call = (Call)key.attachment();
897       if (call == null) {
898         return;
899       }
900       if (key.channel() != call.connection.channel) {
901         throw new IOException("doAsyncWrite: bad channel");
902       }
903 
904       synchronized(call.connection.responseQueue) {
905         if (processResponse(call.connection.responseQueue, false)) {
906           try {
907             key.interestOps(0);
908           } catch (CancelledKeyException e) {
909             /* The Listener/reader might have closed the socket.
910              * We don't explicitly cancel the key, so not sure if this will
911              * ever fire.
912              * This warning could be removed.
913              */
914             LOG.warn("Exception while changing ops : " + e);
915           }
916         }
917       }
918     }
919 
920     //
921     // Remove calls that have been pending in the responseQueue
922     // for a long time.
923     //
924     private void doPurge(Call call, long now) throws IOException {
925       synchronized (call.connection.responseQueue) {
926         Iterator<Call> iter = call.connection.responseQueue.listIterator(0);
927         while (iter.hasNext()) {
928           Call nextCall = iter.next();
929           if (now > nextCall.timestamp + purgeTimeout) {
930             closeConnection(nextCall.connection);
931             break;
932           }
933         }
934       }
935     }
936 
937     // Processes one response. Returns true if there are no more pending
938     // data for this channel.
939     //
940     private boolean processResponse(final LinkedList<Call> responseQueue,
941                                     boolean inHandler) throws IOException {
942       boolean error = true;
943       boolean done = false;       // there is more data for this channel.
944       int numElements;
945       Call call = null;
946       try {
947         //noinspection SynchronizationOnLocalVariableOrMethodParameter
948         synchronized (responseQueue) {
949           //
950           // If there are no items for this channel, then we are done
951           //
952           numElements = responseQueue.size();
953           if (numElements == 0) {
954             error = false;
955             return true;              // no more data for this channel.
956           }
957           //
958           // Extract the first call
959           //
960           call = responseQueue.peek();
961           SocketChannel channel = call.connection.channel;
962           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
963             LOG.debug(getName() + ": responding to #" + call.id + " from " +
964                       call.connection);
965           }
966           //
967           // Send as much data as we can in the non-blocking fashion
968           //
969           int numBytes = channelWrite(channel, call.response);
970           if (numBytes < 0) {
971             // Error flag is set, so returning here closes connection and
972             // clears responseQueue.                   
973             return true;
974           }
975           if (!call.response.hasRemaining()) {
976             responseQueue.poll();
977             responseQueuesSizeThrottler.decrease(call.response.limit());    
978             call.connection.decRpcCount();
979             //noinspection RedundantIfStatement
980             if (numElements == 1) {    // last call fully processes.
981               done = true;             // no more data for this channel.
982             } else {
983               done = false;            // more calls pending to be sent.
984             }
985             if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
986               LOG.debug(getName() + ": responding to #" + call.id + " from " +
987                         call.connection + " Wrote " + numBytes + " bytes.");
988             }
989           } else {
990             if (inHandler) {
991               // set the serve time when the response has to be sent later
992               call.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
993               if (enqueueInSelector(call))
994                 done = true;
995             }
996             if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
997               LOG.debug(getName() + ": responding to #" + call.id + " from " +
998                         call.connection + " Wrote partial " + numBytes +
999                         " bytes.");
1000             }
1001           }
1002           error = false;              // everything went off well
1003         }
1004       } finally {
1005         if (error && call != null) {
1006           LOG.warn(getName()+", call " + call + ": output error");
1007           done = true;               // error. no more data for this channel.
1008           closeConnection(call.connection);
1009         }
1010       }
1011       return done;
1012     }
1013 
1014     //
1015     // Enqueue for background thread to send responses out later.
1016     //
1017     private boolean enqueueInSelector(Call call) throws IOException {
1018       boolean done = false;
1019       incPending();
1020       try {
1021         // Wake up the thread blocked on select, only then can the call
1022         // to channel.register() complete.
1023         SocketChannel channel = call.connection.channel;
1024         writeSelector.wakeup();
1025         channel.register(writeSelector, SelectionKey.OP_WRITE, call);
1026       } catch (ClosedChannelException e) {
1027         //It's OK.  Channel might be closed else where.
1028         done = true;
1029       } finally {
1030         decPending();
1031       }
1032       return done;
1033     }
1034 
1035     //
1036     // Enqueue a response from the application.
1037     //
1038     void doRespond(Call call) throws IOException {
1039       // set the serve time when the response has to be sent later
1040       call.timestamp = System.currentTimeMillis();
1041 
1042       boolean doRegister = false;
1043       boolean closed;
1044       try {
1045         responseQueuesSizeThrottler.increase(call.response.remaining());
1046       } catch (InterruptedException ie) {
1047         throw new InterruptedIOException(ie.getMessage());
1048       }
1049       synchronized (call.connection.responseQueue) {
1050         closed = call.connection.closed;
1051         if (!closed) {
1052           call.connection.responseQueue.addLast(call);
1053 
1054           if (call.connection.responseQueue.size() == 1) {
1055             doRegister = !processResponse(call.connection.responseQueue, false);
1056           }
1057         }
1058       }
1059       if (doRegister) {
1060         enqueueInSelector(call);
1061       }
1062       if (closed) {
1063         // Connection was closed when we tried to submit response, but we
1064         // increased responseQueues size already. It shoud be
1065         // decreased here.
1066         responseQueuesSizeThrottler.decrease(call.response.remaining());
1067       }      
1068     }
1069 
1070     private synchronized void incPending() {   // call waiting to be enqueued.
1071       pending++;
1072     }
1073 
1074     private synchronized void decPending() { // call done enqueueing.
1075       pending--;
1076       notify();
1077     }
1078 
1079     private synchronized void waitPending() throws InterruptedException {
1080       while (pending > 0) {
1081         wait();
1082       }
1083     }
1084   }
1085 
1086   /** Reads calls from a connection and queues them for handling. */
1087   protected class Connection {
1088     private boolean versionRead = false; //if initial signature and
1089                                          //version are read
1090     private boolean headerRead = false;  //if the connection header that
1091                                          //follows version is read.
1092 
1093     protected volatile boolean closed = false;    // indicates if connection was closed
1094     protected SocketChannel channel;
1095     private ByteBuffer data;
1096     private ByteBuffer dataLengthBuffer;
1097     protected final LinkedList<Call> responseQueue;
1098     private volatile int rpcCount = 0; // number of outstanding rpcs
1099     private long lastContact;
1100     private int dataLength;
1101     protected Socket socket;
1102     // Cache the remote host & port info so that even if the socket is
1103     // disconnected, we can say where it used to connect to.
1104     protected String hostAddress;
1105     protected int remotePort;
1106     ConnectionHeader header = new ConnectionHeader();
1107     Class<? extends VersionedProtocol> protocol;
1108     protected User ticket = null;
1109 
1110     public Connection(SocketChannel channel, long lastContact) {
1111       this.channel = channel;
1112       this.lastContact = lastContact;
1113       this.data = null;
1114       this.dataLengthBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(4);
1115       this.socket = channel.socket();
1116       InetAddress addr = socket.getInetAddress();
1117       if (addr == null) {
1118         this.hostAddress = "*Unknown*";
1119       } else {
1120         this.hostAddress = addr.getHostAddress();
1121       }
1122       this.remotePort = socket.getPort();
1123       this.responseQueue = new LinkedList<Call>();
1124       if (socketSendBufferSize != 0) {
1125         try {
1126           socket.setSendBufferSize(socketSendBufferSize);
1127         } catch (IOException e) {
1128           LOG.warn("Connection: unable to set socket send buffer size to " +
1129                    socketSendBufferSize);
1130         }
1131       }
1132     }
1133 
1134     @Override
1135     public String toString() {
1136       return getHostAddress() + ":" + remotePort;
1137     }
1138 
1139     public String getHostAddress() {
1140       return hostAddress;
1141     }
1142 
1143     public int getRemotePort() {
1144       return remotePort;
1145     }
1146 
1147     public void setLastContact(long lastContact) {
1148       this.lastContact = lastContact;
1149     }
1150 
1151     public long getLastContact() {
1152       return lastContact;
1153     }
1154 
1155     /* Return true if the connection has no outstanding rpc */
1156     private boolean isIdle() {
1157       return rpcCount == 0;
1158     }
1159 
1160     /* Decrement the outstanding RPC count */
1161     protected void decRpcCount() {
1162       rpcCount--;
1163     }
1164 
1165     /* Increment the outstanding RPC count */
1166     protected void incRpcCount() {
1167       rpcCount++;
1168     }
1169 
1170     protected boolean timedOut(long currentTime) {
1171       return isIdle() && currentTime - lastContact > maxIdleTime;
1172     }
1173 
1174     public int readAndProcess() throws IOException, InterruptedException {
1175       while (true) {
1176         /* Read at most one RPC. If the header is not read completely yet
1177          * then iterate until we read first RPC or until there is no data left.
1178          */
1179         int count;
1180         if (dataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0) {
1181           count = channelRead(channel, dataLengthBuffer);
1182           if (count < 0 || dataLengthBuffer.remaining() > 0)
1183             return count;
1184         }
1185 
1186         if (!versionRead) {
1187           //Every connection is expected to send the header.
1188           ByteBuffer versionBuffer = ByteBuffer.allocate(1);
1189           count = channelRead(channel, versionBuffer);
1190           if (count <= 0) {
1191             return count;
1192           }
1193           int version = versionBuffer.get(0);
1194 
1195           dataLengthBuffer.flip();
1196           if (!HEADER.equals(dataLengthBuffer) || version != CURRENT_VERSION) {
1197             //Warning is ok since this is not supposed to happen.
1198             LOG.warn("Incorrect header or version mismatch from " +
1199                      hostAddress + ":" + remotePort +
1200                      " got version " + version +
1201                      " expected version " + CURRENT_VERSION);
1202             setupBadVersionResponse(version);
1203             return -1;
1204           }
1205           dataLengthBuffer.clear();
1206           versionRead = true;
1207           continue;
1208         }
1209 
1210         if (data == null) {
1211           dataLengthBuffer.flip();
1212           dataLength = dataLengthBuffer.getInt();
1213 
1214           if (dataLength == HBaseClient.PING_CALL_ID) {
1215             dataLengthBuffer.clear();
1216             return 0;  //ping message
1217           }
1218           data = ByteBuffer.allocate(dataLength);
1219           incRpcCount();  // Increment the rpc count
1220         }
1221 
1222         count = channelRead(channel, data);
1223 
1224         if (data.remaining() == 0) {
1225           dataLengthBuffer.clear();
1226           data.flip();
1227           if (headerRead) {
1228             processData(data.array());
1229             data = null;
1230             return count;
1231           }
1232           processHeader();
1233           headerRead = true;
1234           data = null;
1235           continue;
1236         }
1237         return count;
1238       }
1239     }
1240 
1241     /**
1242      * Try to set up the response to indicate that the client version
1243      * is incompatible with the server. This can contain special-case
1244      * code to speak enough of past IPC protocols to pass back
1245      * an exception to the caller.
1246      * @param clientVersion the version the caller is using
1247      * @throws IOException
1248      */
1249     private void setupBadVersionResponse(int clientVersion) throws IOException {
1250       String errMsg = "Server IPC version " + CURRENT_VERSION +
1251       " cannot communicate with client version " + clientVersion;
1252       ByteArrayOutputStream buffer = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1253 
1254       if (clientVersion >= 3) {
1255         // We used to return an id of -1 which caused server to close the
1256         // connection without telling the client what the problem was.  Now
1257         // we return 0 which will keep the socket up -- bad clients, unless
1258         // they switch to suit the running server -- will fail later doing
1259         // getProtocolVersion.
1260         Call fakeCall =  new Call(0, null, this, responder, 0);
1261         // Versions 3 and greater can interpret this exception
1262         // response in the same manner
1263         setupResponse(buffer, fakeCall, Status.FATAL,
1264             null, VersionMismatch.class.getName(), errMsg);
1265 
1266         responder.doRespond(fakeCall);
1267       }
1268     }
1269 
1270     /// Reads the connection header following version
1271     private void processHeader() throws IOException {
1272       DataInputStream in =
1273         new DataInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(data.array()));
1274       header.readFields(in);
1275       try {
1276         String protocolClassName = header.getProtocol();
1277         if (protocolClassName == null) {
1278           protocolClassName = "org.apache.hadoop.hbase.ipc.HRegionInterface";
1279         }
1280         protocol = getProtocolClass(protocolClassName, conf);
1281       } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
1282         throw new IOException("Unknown protocol: " + header.getProtocol());
1283       }
1284 
1285       ticket = header.getUser();
1286     }
1287 
1288     protected void processData(byte[] buf) throws  IOException, InterruptedException {
1289       DataInputStream dis =
1290         new DataInputStream(new ByteArrayInputStream(buf));
1291       int id = dis.readInt();                    // try to read an id
1292       long callSize = buf.length;
1293 
1294       if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1295         LOG.debug(" got call #" + id + ", " + callSize + " bytes");
1296       }
1297 
1298       // Enforcing the call queue size, this triggers a retry in the client
1299       if ((callSize + callQueueSize.get()) > maxQueueSize) {
1300         final Call callTooBig =
1301           new Call(id, null, this, responder, callSize);
1302         ByteArrayOutputStream responseBuffer = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1303         setupResponse(responseBuffer, callTooBig, Status.FATAL, null,
1304             IOException.class.getName(),
1305             "Call queue is full, is ipc.server.max.callqueue.size too small?");
1306         responder.doRespond(callTooBig);
1307         return;
1308       }
1309 
1310       Writable param;
1311       try {
1312         param = ReflectionUtils.newInstance(paramClass, conf);//read param
1313         param.readFields(dis);
1314       } catch (Throwable t) {
1315         LOG.warn("Unable to read call parameters for client " +
1316                  getHostAddress(), t);
1317         final Call readParamsFailedCall =
1318           new Call(id, null, this, responder, callSize);
1319         ByteArrayOutputStream responseBuffer = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
1320 
1321         setupResponse(responseBuffer, readParamsFailedCall, Status.FATAL, null,
1322             t.getClass().getName(),
1323             "IPC server unable to read call parameters: " + t.getMessage());
1324         responder.doRespond(readParamsFailedCall);
1325         return;
1326       }
1327       Call call = new Call(id, param, this, responder, callSize);
1328       callQueueSize.add(callSize);
1329 
1330       if (priorityCallQueue != null && getQosLevel(param) > highPriorityLevel) {
1331         priorityCallQueue.put(call);
1332         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(priorityCallQueue);
1333       } else if (replicationQueue != null && getQosLevel(param) == HConstants.REPLICATION_QOS) {
1334         replicationQueue.put(call);
1335         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(replicationQueue);
1336       } else {
1337         callQueue.put(call); // queue the call; maybe blocked here
1338         updateCallQueueLenMetrics(callQueue);
1339       }
1340     }
1341 
1342     protected synchronized void close() {
1343       closed = true;
1344       data = null;
1345       dataLengthBuffer = null;
1346       if (!channel.isOpen())
1347         return;
1348       try {socket.shutdownOutput();} catch(Exception ignored) {} // FindBugs DE_MIGHT_IGNORE
1349       if (channel.isOpen()) {
1350         try {channel.close();} catch(Exception ignored) {}
1351       }
1352       try {socket.close();} catch(Exception ignored) {}
1353     }
1354   }
1355 
1356   /**
1357    * Reports length of the call queue to HBaseRpcMetrics.
1358    * @param queue Which queue to report
1359    */
1360   protected void updateCallQueueLenMetrics(BlockingQueue<Call> queue) {
1361     if (queue == callQueue) {
1362       rpcMetrics.callQueueLen.set(callQueue.size());
1363     } else if (queue == priorityCallQueue) {
1364       rpcMetrics.priorityCallQueueLen.set(priorityCallQueue.size());
1365     } else if (queue == replicationQueue) {
1366       rpcMetrics.replicationCallQueueLen.set(replicationQueue.size());
1367     } else {
1368       LOG.warn("Unknown call queue");
1369     }
1370   }
1371 
1372   /** Handles queued calls . */
1373   private class Handler extends Thread {
1374     private final BlockingQueue<Call> myCallQueue;
1375     private MonitoredRPCHandler status;
1376 
1377     public Handler(final BlockingQueue<Call> cq, int instanceNumber) {
1378       this.myCallQueue = cq;
1379       this.setDaemon(true);
1380 
1381       String threadName = "IPC Server handler " + instanceNumber + " on " + port;
1382       if (cq == priorityCallQueue) {
1383         // this is just an amazing hack, but it works.
1384         threadName = "PRI " + threadName;
1385       } else if (cq == replicationQueue) {
1386         threadName = "REPL " + threadName;
1387       }
1388       this.setName(threadName);
1389       this.status = TaskMonitor.get().createRPCStatus(threadName);
1390     }
1391 
1392     @Override
1393     public void run() {
1394       LOG.info(getName() + ": starting");
1395       status.setStatus("starting");
1396       SERVER.set(HBaseServer.this);
1397       while (running) {
1398         try {
1399           status.pause("Waiting for a call");
1400           Call call = myCallQueue.take(); // pop the queue; maybe blocked here
1401           updateCallQueueLenMetrics(myCallQueue);
1402           status.setStatus("Setting up call");
1403           status.setConnection(call.connection.getHostAddress(), 
1404               call.connection.getRemotePort());
1405 
1406           if (LOG.isDebugEnabled())
1407             LOG.debug(getName() + ": has #" + call.id + " from " +
1408                       call.connection);
1409 
1410           String errorClass = null;
1411           String error = null;
1412           Writable value = null;
1413 
1414           CurCall.set(call);
1415           try {
1416             if (!started)
1417               throw new ServerNotRunningYetException("Server is not running yet");
1418 
1419             if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {
1420               User remoteUser = call.connection.ticket;
1421               LOG.debug(getName() + ": call #" + call.id + " executing as "
1422                   + (remoteUser == null ? "NULL principal" : remoteUser.getName()));
1423             }
1424 
1425             RequestContext.set(call.connection.ticket, getRemoteIp(),
1426                 call.connection.protocol);
1427             // make the call
1428             value = call(call.connection.protocol, call.param, call.timestamp, 
1429                 status);
1430           } catch (Throwable e) {
1431             LOG.debug(getName()+", call "+call+": error: " + e, e);
1432             errorClass = e.getClass().getName();
1433             error = StringUtils.stringifyException(e);
1434           } finally {
1435             // Must always clear the request context to avoid leaking
1436             // credentials between requests.
1437             RequestContext.clear();
1438           }
1439           CurCall.set(null);
1440           callQueueSize.add(call.getSize() * -1);
1441           // Set the response for undelayed calls and delayed calls with
1442           // undelayed responses.
1443           if (!call.isDelayed() || !call.isReturnValueDelayed()) {
1444             call.setResponse(value,
1445               errorClass == null? Status.SUCCESS: Status.ERROR,
1446                 errorClass, error);
1447           }
1448           call.sendResponseIfReady();
1449           status.markComplete("Sent response");
1450         } catch (InterruptedException e) {
1451           if (running) {                          // unexpected -- log it
1452             LOG.info(getName() + " caught: " +
1453                      StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
1454           }
1455         } catch (OutOfMemoryError e) {
1456           if (errorHandler != null) {
1457             if (errorHandler.checkOOME(e)) {
1458               LOG.info(getName() + ": exiting on OOME");
1459               return;
1460             }
1461           } else {
1462             // rethrow if no handler
1463             throw e;
1464           }
1465        } catch (ClosedChannelException cce) {
1466           LOG.warn(getName() + " caught a ClosedChannelException, " +
1467             "this means that the server was processing a " +
1468             "request but the client went away. The error message was: " +
1469             cce.getMessage());
1470         } catch (Exception e) {
1471           LOG.warn(getName() + " caught: " +
1472                    StringUtils.stringifyException(e));
1473         }
1474       }
1475       LOG.info(getName() + ": exiting");
1476     }
1477 
1478   }

1588   /**
1589    * Setup response for the IPC Call.
1590    *
1591    * @param response buffer to serialize the response into
1592    * @param call {@link Call} to which we are setting up the response
1593    * @param status {@link Status} of the IPC call
1594    * @param rv return value for the IPC Call, if the call was successful
1595    * @param errorClass error class, if the the call failed
1596    * @param error error message, if the call failed
1597    * @throws IOException
1598    */
1599   private void setupResponse(ByteArrayOutputStream response,
1600                              Call call, Status status,
1601                              Writable rv, String errorClass, String error)
1602   throws IOException {
1603     response.reset();
1604     DataOutputStream out = new DataOutputStream(response);
1605 
1606     if (status == Status.SUCCESS) {
1607       try {
1608         rv.write(out);
1609         call.setResponse(rv, status, null, null);
1610       } catch (Throwable t) {
1611         LOG.warn("Error serializing call response for call " + call, t);
1612         // Call back to same function - this is OK since the
1613         // buffer is reset at the top, and since status is changed
1614         // to ERROR it won't infinite loop.
1615         call.setResponse(null, status.ERROR, t.getClass().getName(),
1616             StringUtils.stringifyException(t));
1617       }
1618     } else {
1619       call.setResponse(rv, status, errorClass, error);
1620     }
1621   }

1623   protected void closeConnection(Connection connection) {
1624     synchronized (connectionList) {
1625       if (connectionList.remove(connection)) {
1626         numConnections--;
1627       }
1628     }
1629     connection.close();
1630     long bytes = 0;
1631     synchronized (connection.responseQueue) {
1632       for (Call c : connection.responseQueue) {
1633         bytes += c.response.limit();
1634       }
1635       connection.responseQueue.clear();
1636     }
1637     responseQueuesSizeThrottler.decrease(bytes);    
1638     rpcMetrics.numOpenConnections.set(numConnections);
1639   }

1662   /**
1663    * Starts the service threads but does not allow requests to be responded yet.
1664    * Client will get {@link ServerNotRunningYetException} instead.
1665    */
1666   @Override
1667   public synchronized void startThreads() {
1668     responder.start();
1669     listener.start();
1670     handlers = startHandlers(callQueue, handlerCount);
1671     priorityHandlers = startHandlers(priorityCallQueue, priorityHandlerCount);
1672     replicationHandlers = startHandlers(replicationQueue, numOfReplicationHandlers);
1673     }

1675   private Handler[] startHandlers(BlockingQueue<Call> queue, int numOfHandlers) {
1676     if (numOfHandlers <= 0) {
1677       return null;
1678     }
1679     Handler[] handlers = new Handler[numOfHandlers];
1680     for (int i = 0; i < numOfHandlers; i++) {
1681       handlers[i] = new Handler(queue, i);
1682       handlers[i].start();
1683     }
1684     return handlers;
1685   }

1687   /** Stops the service.  No new calls will be handled after this is called. */
1688   @Override
1689   public synchronized void stop() {
1690     LOG.info("Stopping server on " + port);
1691     running = false;
1692     stopHandlers(handlers);
1693     stopHandlers(priorityHandlers);
1694     stopHandlers(replicationHandlers);
1695     listener.interrupt();
1696     listener.doStop();
1697     responder.interrupt();
1698     notifyAll();
1699     if (this.rpcMetrics != null) {
1700       this.rpcMetrics.shutdown();
1701     }
1702   }

1704   private void stopHandlers(Handler[] handlers) {
1705     if (handlers != null) {
1706       for (Handler handler : handlers) {
1707         if (handler != null) {
1708           handler.interrupt();
1709         }
1710       }
1711     }
1712   }

1751   /**
1752    * When the read or write buffer size is larger than this limit, i/o will be
1753    * done in chunks of this size. Most RPC requests and responses would be
1754    * be smaller.
1755    */
1756   private static int NIO_BUFFER_LIMIT = 64 * 1024; //should not be more than 64KB.
1757 
1758   /**
1759    * This is a wrapper around {@link java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel#write(java.nio.ByteBuffer)}.
1760    * If the amount of data is large, it writes to channel in smaller chunks.
1761    * This is to avoid jdk from creating many direct buffers as the size of
1762    * buffer increases. This also minimizes extra copies in NIO layer
1763    * as a result of multiple write operations required to write a large
1764    * buffer.
1765    *
1766    * @param channel writable byte channel to write to
1767    * @param buffer buffer to write
1768    * @return number of bytes written
1769    * @throws java.io.IOException e
1770    * @see java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel#write(java.nio.ByteBuffer)
1771    */
1772   protected int channelWrite(WritableByteChannel channel,
1773                                     ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException {
1774 
1775     int count =  (buffer.remaining() <= NIO_BUFFER_LIMIT) ?
1776            channel.write(buffer) : channelIO(null, channel, buffer);
1777     if (count > 0) {
1778       rpcMetrics.sentBytes.inc(count);
1779     }
1780     return count;
1781   }
1782 
1783   /**
1784    * This is a wrapper around {@link java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel#read(java.nio.ByteBuffer)}.
1785    * If the amount of data is large, it writes to channel in smaller chunks.
1786    * This is to avoid jdk from creating many direct buffers as the size of
1787    * ByteBuffer increases. There should not be any performance degredation.
1788    *
1789    * @param channel writable byte channel to write on
1790    * @param buffer buffer to write
1791    * @return number of bytes written
1792    * @throws java.io.IOException e
1793    * @see java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel#read(java.nio.ByteBuffer)
1794    */
1795   protected int channelRead(ReadableByteChannel channel,
1796                                    ByteBuffer buffer) throws IOException {
1797 
1798     int count = (buffer.remaining() <= NIO_BUFFER_LIMIT) ?
1799            channel.read(buffer) : channelIO(channel, null, buffer);
1800     if (count > 0) {
1801       rpcMetrics.receivedBytes.inc(count);
1802   }
1803     return count;
1804   }
1805 
1806   /**
1807    * Helper for {@link #channelRead(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel, java.nio.ByteBuffer)}
1808    * and {@link #channelWrite(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel, java.nio.ByteBuffer)}. Only
1809    * one of readCh or writeCh should be non-null.
1810    *
1811    * @param readCh read channel
1812    * @param writeCh write channel
1813    * @param buf buffer to read or write into/out of
1814    * @return bytes written
1815    * @throws java.io.IOException e
1816    * @see #channelRead(java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel, java.nio.ByteBuffer)
1817    * @see #channelWrite(java.nio.channels.WritableByteChannel, java.nio.ByteBuffer)
1818    */
1819   private static int channelIO(ReadableByteChannel readCh,
1820                                WritableByteChannel writeCh,
1821                                ByteBuffer buf) throws IOException {
1822 
1823     int originalLimit = buf.limit();
1824     int initialRemaining = buf.remaining();
1825     int ret = 0;
1826 
1827     while (buf.remaining() > 0) {
1828       try {
1829         int ioSize = Math.min(buf.remaining(), NIO_BUFFER_LIMIT);
1830         buf.limit(buf.position() + ioSize);
1831 
1832         ret = (readCh == null) ? writeCh.write(buf) : readCh.read(buf);
1833 
1834         if (ret < ioSize) {
1835           break;
1836         }
1837 
1838       } finally {
1839         buf.limit(originalLimit);
1840       }
1841     }
1842 
1843     int nBytes = initialRemaining - buf.remaining();
1844     return (nBytes > 0) ? nBytes : ret;
1845   }
